Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: Absolutely prime position, 5 star service from arrival to departure, substantial breakfast and a very comfortable bed. Having a room over the street was lovely as there are windows to open and view the rooftops. Staff were happy to book restaurants and shows. So helpful! A lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Phylmont
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Millesime in March, our 4th trip to Paris and our first time staying at this hotel. We have nothing but praise for the welcome we received and the kind, attentive service from Inga and all of the staff who manned the front desk during our stay. The hotel is cozy, charming and immaculate. The décor of the breakfast room is lovely and makes you realize that you are in Paris. The breakfast was more than adequate and provided us with a great start to our day, and the women serving coffee and replenishing the buffet were sweet and efficient. Rooms are decorated very simply and the size of our superior room was perfect. Although our room faced the street, it was extremely quiet. Our package included private transfers to and from the airport, which lessened any stress we might have had. As we are walkers, we were able to walk just about everywhere, but we were thankful for the metro stations close by when at the end of the day, we ended up several miles away and needed to return to the hotel. An abundance of cafes and the lively Rue de Buci were in the neighborhood. We are already looking forward to our next stay at the Millesime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at the heart of Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: Marcosuru
Reviews.Content: A nice and well located little hotel. Quiet and clean. Friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “The BEST!”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Millésime many times and have never been disappointed. This is a successful establishment because it has the perfect combination of staff, location and service! The staff is outstanding: Inga, Giada, Kostya, everyone. They cannot do enough to make your stay pleasant. The hotel interior is warm and inviting, simply decorated. The rooms are large by Paris standards and very well equipped. The breakfast room is pleasant. Breakfast is buffet style and consists of breads, pastries, cheese, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, coffee/tea. The breakfast staff is friendly and accommodating. The hotel location is superb, within walking distance of many of the major sights and very conveniently located to several métro stops, wonderful restaurants and shopping. The hotel website offers a number of promotions for longer stays that include some combination of breakfast, airport transportion, a cruise on the Seine, museum tickets, etc., depending on the length of stay. There are also a number of thoughtful touches such as a welcome bottle of wine, a plate of macarons, a dish of fresh fruit that reflect the care that the Millésime and its staff have taken to stand out. I highly recommend the Millésime Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Already in LOVE”
Reviews.Author: kim m
Reviews.Content: I have not even stepped foot in the hotel and it is fabulous! I just booked via internet. I had a few questions through email and they have been so great.Special thank you to their concierge Kostya! Looking forward to our stay with them!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Stay”
Reviews.Author: jbs5665
Reviews.Content: If you want the perfect location, room, breakfast, hotel staff and comfy bed - stay here. My husband and I were here last week - and were sad to leave! It is the perfect location to walk to the major sights and there are metro stations within a couple of blocks. Inga, at the desk, helped us almost daily with travel directions and ideas and restaurant recommendations and the breakfast hostess greeted us each morning with a delicious and beautifully appointed breakfast and room. The breakfast was delicious and the perfect way to start each day. We booked the "tete d' tete" package and received many extras that made our stay even more enjoyable - airport transfers, Musee d' Orsay tickets, Seine cruise tickets, metro pass and a drink coupon for a lovely nearby restaurant. I can't say enough about this charming, elegant hotel. We are already planning another trip and will definitely stay here. I can't wait to take our daughter for her senior graduation and let her meet these charming people at this lovely hotel. I hate to give away such a great secret - but since I found it here on tripadvisor - I have to share it with my friends! Nearby traditional French restaurants were recommended by the hotel staff, which we enjoyed. Inga, Sietka, Giada and everyone at this hotel make this the perfect place to stay. Thank you for a wonderful week. I am yet another who has fallen in love with Paris and its lovely people! Bon jour!

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location and the staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bandlady
Reviews.Content: We, too, chose the Millesime based on Tripadvisor, and were completely satisfied. My husband, myself, and our two young adult children arrived very early and the hotel stored our bags so we could walk around and enjoy lunch until our rooms were ready. The superior rooms are quite roomy by European standards, with comfortable beds, a desk, small dining table, and a big closet for clothes and suitcases. The bathroom was large and nicely tiled, with a very warm, powerful shower and nice toiletries. We were surprised how quiet it was, considering the room was right on the street. As a convenience we ate breakfast at the hotel and were again not disappointed. The breakfast room is lovely and the pastries are divine. Josette was a wonderfully friendly personality to wake up to each morning! Yes, the best part of this place is the staff. Our French is pretty bare-bones, and everyone we met at the front desk spoke excellent English. We particularly want to thank Konstantin and Giada for their help and recommendations. The Millesime is located in Ste. Germain section, which we found to be perfect for us as first-time travelers to Paris. There were all sorts of shops, cafes, and restaurants within short walking distance, as well as 3 different Metro stops. Also, you can easily walk to the Louvre, Orsay, and Notre Dame. We would recommend Au 35 down the street for dinner and Amorino on Rue Buci for gelato. By the way, with the winter promotion, we got 6 nights for the price of 5, including a one-way airport transfer. The Millesime is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Millesime Hotel for 4 nights based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor. It certainly lived up to all of our expectations. The location is perfect. We were able to walk to the Notre Dame, The Louvre, Musee d'orsay and even the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood was quiet and charming. Staff spoke fluent English and provided excellent dining recommendations. We had a great experience and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkly_John55
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel in a good location. The staff are friendly and helpful and the hotel is very well maintained. Loved the tiny lift and well trodden oak staircase. Superior rooms at the front of the hotel are a decent size. The standard rooms at the rear are cozy. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank delight”
Reviews.Author: sommerfld
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely week here and it was the perfect place to stay. A wonderful "deal" offered 6 nights for the price of 5 as well as breakfast everyday, tickets on a Seine tour boat one evening, wine and macarons in my room, and a private car to the airport for my departure. The location was fabulous, especially for a single traveler - close to several Metro and bus stops, many cafes, markets, shops and restaurants, as well as tourist attractions. The staff were welcoming and offered excellent suggestions and directions. My room was spacious with a balcony and a modern bath offering respite after days of walking miles. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionnel, essential experience”
Reviews.Author: pono808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Millesime in the 6th Arrondissement for all the right reasons, and this hotel was the one we were fortunate enough to have reserved. The staff were as lovely and helpful as can be- everyone from the breakfast room Mesdames to the Chamber Maids to the Receptionists/Concierges and the Manager. The hotel is charming and immaculate, room was nice and comfy (bigger than I expected), cheerful and well-appointed, and in the most perfect location for exploring the beautiful city of lights, Paris... The tete-a-tete (head to head) with Paris package was romantic and included things we would want to do anyway, making this a perfect deal in a perfect spot with perfect hosts/hostesses! Manager Inga went above and beyond her call to duty, effectively averting what would have been a high drama disaster (she inexplicably retrieved my brand new camera which I had inadvertently dropped and left inside a taxi- oh la la, those first few days of our trip's entire memories preserved and salvaged by one act of kindness, hard work and determination- in short, a miracle!...) This 5 day start to a longer holiday was by far the favorite- and a big part of it was Inga and her team.... Can't wait to return again, hopefully soon! And for a much longer stay (though we managed to pack in a ton...) Merci mille fois et au revoir- bonne annee, a mes nouveaux amis a Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Charm with a capital "ch"”
Reviews.Author: biztripJoburg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really well situated for the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. It's within a few minutes walking distance and the hotel can provide advance tickets for the day to both museums which can save a lot of queuing time at busy periods. The hotel is in a quiet street amid the artr shops of the elft bank. We liked the way the rooms were furnished and decorated, although the decor may be considered a little sparse - some art on the walls would be good. We reserved a superior double room and it was very spacious, especially for Paris. Excellent bathroom, very modern and well equipped with nice towels etc but no moisturiser, for some reason. Breakfasts were good although without any variation from day to day. There was a signficant extra charge for eggs and anything cooked. Plenty of fruit, bread and pastries, cereals, yoghurts etc so no chance of going hungry. Reception staff were excellent and extremely helpful. All spoke excellent English and were charming. If we go back to Paris we would have absolutely no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ledunk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel during Christmas for 8 days. We got the Winter Promotion which included 1 free night and it was very affordable. We stayed in a superior room which was a good size for Europe and had a nice bathroom and shower. The bed and bedding were comfortable. The hotel is on a great little street in a nice area of town close to the Seine. There are plenty of restaurants, shops and bakeries all around. The hotel is very clean and the staff is great. We received different treats every night including 1/2 bottles of wine and macarones (delicious). We did a lot of research before our trip and were happy with our choice. Thanks Millesime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: KemeBruges
Reviews.Content: The Millesime hotel is located in the heart of St-Germain des Prés, the best shopping district with an ultimate combination of bars and restaurants. The staff is very helpfull, the hotel is clean & tidy. Upon our arrival we were offered a bottle of wine. It was the start of a perfect city trip. Our room was located at the front of the hotel, but we didn't have any problems with noise on the street. The breakfast is very good as well. It was the 7th time I went to Paris, this time together with my mother for a "city trip amongst girls for shopping!" and we really loved this hotel. I would certainly come here again. As we were planning our trip we weren't sure if we would take a hotel near the Gare du Nord or in the city center. After this amazing experience, there are no more doubts. A hotel in the center is the best choice. Millesime hotel is very close to the metro station so no need to be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RobinLG
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our expectations and then some - perfect location for walking to sites, wonderful old Paris area with a lot of galleries and cafes, excellent hotel staff - very helpful and fluent in many languages including English AND comfortable room and satisfying breakfast. Even my French friends were impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Millesime started off our 2 weeks in France with 5 stars !!”
Reviews.Author: lovescoffee
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel in a location which will permit you to walk to museums, the "sights," cafes/restaurants and shopping, and which feels like being on a quiet street in a real neighborhood, you'd be hard pressed to find a better alternative, especially for the value. As soon as we walked through the front door, we felt welcomed and this continued through the week we were there with little touches like wine, fruit, cookies and macarons. Our room was simple and small but filled our needs and the bathroom was fabulous - completely redone, lots of shelf space, and - ladies, you will appreciate this - a large magnifying mirror on the wall so you don't have to stretch across the sink to put your makeup on. I cannot comment on the breakfast room since we chose to walk 2 short blocks to the square, lined with cafes, which we came to think of as "our own;" within a day or so, we settled into our favorite cafe where the waiters began to recognize us. What was most special, though, were the staff. Olga, Giada and Nicolas - I take my hat off to the 3 of you. All three were extremely helpful with directions, recommendations, answers to questions (many of which concerned the differences between life in Paris and life in the US) and suggestions for discounted tickets, e.g., to a spectacular concert in Ste. Chappelle and a Paris-by-night boat tour. All of this was delivered with warmth, knowledge and the feeling communicated that our enjoyment was pleasurable to them as well. I've attached photos to hopefully give you a taste of what you'll see and experience when you stay at the Millesime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dbeanie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spend 6 evenings at this charming hotel and loved it. Our room was a nice size and overlooked the rooftops of the 6th arrondissement which is exactly what we wanted. Our bed was extremely comfortable and the staff would leave little gifts for us including, wine and cookies. The breakfast room downstairs was absolutely charming and started our days off on a happy note. Last, but certainly not least, the staff was wonderful . Inga and Giada helped us with maps suggestions and wonderful restaurant selections. They were excellent! The location and hospitality of this hotel can't be beat. i hope to stay again in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, intimate lovely hotel in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: MrMarkini
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely and charming hotel in a perfect location in the Sixth. We stayed in Room 15, which you reach by going through the tiny enclosed courtyard and up a staircase - like a nest! Great bed, huge sparkling tiled bathroom. The staff were warm, personable, helpful and intent on us having a nice time. I can't speak for all of the rooms, but this room was extraordinarily, almost eerily, quiet, even on Friday and Saturday nights, when there were plenty of revelers in the neighborhood. We took the RER from Charles de Gaulle, and walked 15 mins to the hotel - here's a tip, by the way - instead of getting on or off the RER at St Michel (a maelstrom of a station), get off at Luxembourg, where you emerge next to the Jardin and walk through quieter, wider, streets to the hotel. It's an extra 100 yards, but so much more pleasant! Nearby are good cafes for coffee or breakfast (including an outpost of Paul, the famous bakery) and for a drink or snack (on the rue Bonaparte). Close to Metro stops at Mabillon, St. Germain and Odeon. At the hotel's urging, we also took our first Paris bus - the 63, which was beautiful and efficient. We can't say enough about this cozy and very French little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: tejo42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millesime earlier this month and had an outstanding experience. Our package included free transportation from the airport. Our flight arrived late. Nevertheless, the hotel took care of us. Great location in the 6th arrondissement near St. Germain des Pres. We also had a breakfast package. The breakfast room is very attractive; the staff is excellent; the selection of breakfast items is varied and very good. The room was large; bathroom uncommonly large by European standards; the ambiance is terrific. All staff were gracious, multilingual, thoughtful and completely helpful. Overall grade: A

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home after yet another stay at the Hôtel Millésime and recommend the Millésime highly and without reservation! It is centrally located on a quiet street, rue Jacob, in the St Germain dès Près neighborhood. There are at least three métro stops within a couple of blocks of the hotel as well as several bus routes. It is within walking distance of many of the major sights including the Louvre, the Musée d'Orsay, the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame, Conciergerie, Sainte Chapelle, Luxembourg Gardens, the Cluny Museum (Musée du Moyen Âge). It is near a myriad of cafés, bistros and restaurants. And if the sights, architecture, art, history and food still do not fill the gap, there are many wonderful boutiques nearby as well. The rooms are quiet, large and very well appointed, as are the bathrooms. I have stayed in both the classic room when traveling solo, as I did on this trip, and in the superior room when traveling with my spouse. Both public and private spaces are attractive and immaculate. The rooms have always exceeded my expectations. The staff is knowledgeable and very helpful. Inga and her staff have made the Millésime my home away from home. Thank you and merci!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: IhateNJ
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to be in Paris. We stayed at the Millesime for three nights to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. It is just perfect and ideally located. The train stop is only a few blocks away and it is within walking distance of everything. I think what far exceeded my expectations of this hotel is the staff. I have never had this type of experience while staying in a hotel--they really do go above and beyond. When I arrived to Paris and I got to my beautiful room..there was champagne from the staff waiting in our room and everyday when I returned to my room, there would be a basket with fruit. The staff were always so helpful, with questions, setting up excursions, confirmations...I couldn't have asked for more. There was free Internet access in the room and the staff even helped with printing out my boarding passes when I needed. I had only asked for a quiet room and was provided the most beautiful room that I could have imagined...in the courtyard and up the stairs. I felt like I had my own little home in Paris. What an experience! My three nights in Paris were so special---thanks to all the staff at the Millesime. This will be the only place that I will return to in Paris. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous staff!”
Reviews.Author: RJTB
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from Paris and had a wonderful stay at the Millesime. The hotel is in a perfect location - within walking distance of great sights and restaurants. It is also very convenient to several Metro stops. Inga and Sieta were so very helpful. They went above and beyond to help us coordinate our itinerary for the whole trip. Inga saved us so much time with her helpful hints and was full of great suggestions. Loved the breakfast downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Celebrate”
Reviews.Author: welshkate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millesime for three nights at the beginning of August to celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniversary and the staff certainly helped to make this a special visit. The hotel itself is calm and welcoming, the staff always friendly and ready to help. Our room was tastefully furnished and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was of an extremely high standard and certainly set us up for a days walking around Paris. We are looking forward to a return visit to Paris and the Millesime.

Reviews.Title: “The best place for discovering Paris”
Reviews.Author: Chitob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice, friendly and helpful staff,high quality of services! We stayed 3 nights at the Millesime Hotel, ideally located in the heart of St Germain, in a quite lovely place. Restaurants,main attractions (Louvre, Notre Dame, St Chapelle,Orsay) and metro stations are at walking distance and very easy to reach. We had a classic double room, very clean, confortable and reasonably spacious. The staff is very professional, helpful and always at disposal for giving the best suggestions for discovering the city.The breakfast was absolutly fresh, with a large selection of buffet. Price is also convenient as well as the "special offers" compared to the services, the facilities and the treatment of high quality. The atmosphere is really friendly and with a warm welcome. A special thanks to Giada for everything she did for us and for her precious help. We couldn't expect a better place to stay for our first time in Paris and we highly recommend it also for celebrating some special occasions with a great treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel, again - still raving!!”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millesime in September 2009 and absolutely loved everything about it, so we were very eager to return this July. The general manager, Inga, went out of her way to rearrange her reservations in such a way as to have our "old" room no. 11 ready for us. And what a fantastic room: stylish and functional, with beautiful grey and gold bedding; more then adequate lighting; desk with a chair; flat screen TV; free internet access and a French balcony overlooking the heart of the 6th, rue Jacob; with a chilled white Bordeaux awaiting our arrival; a warm welcome and it was like coming home! There were delicious macaroons and other treats left for us every evening, and gifts to take home. The hotel is in a fantastic location in the 6th within an easy walk to the Louvre, Orsay, great restaurants, cafes, and shopping. Inga and her English speaking staff are super gracious in offering plenty of personal attention and recommendations on things to do and see, and great restaurants to dine at. Everyone from the housekeeper to the night clerk to the attendant in the breakfast room are helpful and pleasant, and went out of their way to assist and make our stay special. And so, we hope to return, real soon. :)

Reviews.Title: “What a great treat!”
Reviews.Author: THS35
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know where to start. The service, the location, the hotel itself... We recently spent 9 nights at the Millesime Hotel in an extended and glorious Birthday in Paris. But before we even arrived, the staff at the Millesime were on the case. When I mentioned in an e-mail that it was going to be my wife's birthday they asked if there was anything special they could arrange for me. And they did! Flowers and chocolates were waiting on our arrival! And that, after being picked up by a personal driver at the airport! No matter who was behind the desk, you couldn't find nicer, more helpful and accommodating people, always there with advice or a personal suggestion - take the bus to Momartin, not the metro - try to have lunch on the island in the Bois de Bologne - little touches like that. And then there were the "treats". Champagne on our arrival, macaroons in our room, bottles of wine in our room, a present for my wife on her birthday, a goodbye gift, the smiles at breakfast, the impromptu French lessons...Honestly, every day was like a new surprise. Even an issue with the air conditioning was dealt with in the most professional way. Thank you so much, all of you!!! The hotel itself is in a perfect location. On a quiet street but very central to everything on the Left Bank and St. Germain de pres. The metro is a three minute walk, the Musee d'Orsay a 15 minute stroll, Notre Dame, the same. The Delacroix Museum literally around the corner. And restaurants and cafes galore! The room was delightful, clean and not cramped at all. On the 4th floor, it had a wonderful view of Paris rooftops. And the best shower we've ever experienced in Europe! The "Tete a tete" package the hotel offers was an amazing bonus. Breakfasts, museum passes, boat rides, and the airport drivers...an incredible deal! All in all the Millesime Hotel (and its wonderful staff) made for the best birthday present ever! Oh yeah...And those nougats on the pillow each day! Whoa!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quaint hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_galTN
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at Millesime Hotel! The staff is friendly and extremely helpful, and the hotel itself is very clean. The room is very comfortable. We had a triple and it was very spacious for Europe. Breakfast is good and gives you a variety. Hotel is in a wonderful location, in the heart of St. GermaIne and within close walking distance to the Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and other sites. It is on a quiet street in a thriving area. We were not disturbed by noise in the night. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: BerkeleyEconomist
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Millesime Hotel for four nights. It was a lovely experience. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. Many cafes are only a block or two away. Around the corner is a street that on weekends turns into a farmers market. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit---Another Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Paramourfa
Reviews.Content: This is just an update from a previous review from a few years ago. The Millisime Hotel remains like a trusted old friend. Everything seems to go well. The rooms are reasonably spacious with nice decorative touches. Since Paris was on the warm side, the air conditioning worked well to provide for cool comfortable sleeping. Breakfast is a real real treat with a buffet that includes several selections of meat, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, rolls, bread, fresh juices, and small pastries. It is all handled most effiiciently by Jossette who has been with the hotel for over ten years. (She is attentive, friendly, and a true professional. The front desk and reservations are in the very capable hands of Inga along with others who make sure that every aspect of your stay is to your satisfaction. A great deal of our love for this city starts and ends each day at the Millisime.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel, Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: perrubud
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at this hotel, and we loved it. Booking well ahead got us a more than fair rate. The whole is experience is professional yet soothing to the jet-lagged traveller. At our request, we were put into a quiet room which was ready at check in time. Staff could not have been more helpful or accomodating. The location is superb: near St. Germain, but also not far from the right bank and good bus and train connections. Of course, Laduree is practically across the street and the good bakeries in the neighborhood definitely show up in their selection of breakfast breads. Also found location good for museums and the core of old Paris: the Louvre, Ile de la Cite as well as a lively quarter of restaurants and markets and every possibly service needed. Their website also points you in the direction of various exhibits and events in Paris well ahead of your staff, very helpful. Strongly recommended but I feel ambivalent about recommending it. Don't want to spoil the small hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ciach
Reviews.Content: We are in our room and the temperature has been in the 85 degree range in our room since we arrived. The Hotel states that it is air conditioned but we have found no evidence of it. The front desk states that it is working and then apologize. We know not to expect US type comfort but this is very poor. With the windows open it gets into the comfortable range about 2:00 am. The Hotel advertises a package that I thought I had booked that includes a number of extras. They say that is not the package that I booked but did offer a private transfer from the airport. The room is small, but I am told that is normal for Paris. The room would be quiet if we did not have to have the windows open constantly. We've had to listen to noisy birds, the police sirens, cats howling and someone having a loud orgasm and obviously they had their windows open also. The location is good and we've had some nice experiences on our trip but staying at the Millesime has not been one of them. We still have 5 nights to stay and the weather is supposed to coo so that may increase the comfort level.. This is our 1st trip to Paris and we are celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and are very disappointed in our choice of lodging, especially for 215 euros per night..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in St Germain”
Reviews.Author: T-dot_Travellers
Reviews.Content: I agonized over where to stay in Paris and am very happy we chose the Millesime Hotel. The location is great on a side street and within a short walking distance of great restaurants, great shopping, all the famous sights and the metro. The front desk staff was excellent as has been previously mentioned. We chose to go with a classic room which I have to say was larger than I expected - king bed (2 twins pushed together), large closet, desk and a large bathroom. We were on the ground floor off the courtyard which may not suit everyone since it didn't really have a proper window (the door was the window and there was a small window above the door that could be opened) but we didn't care since we were out from morning till night. When we arrived they did offer to move us to another room on the first floor but it wasn't ready yet and we really just wanted to check in and explore the city. I think all the classic rooms face the courtyard so if you are really worried about the smell of smoke from people in the courtyard maybe ask for a room on a higher floor or chose a superior room since those face the street. There was only one morning that we actually smelled smoke but it wasn't overpowering. We did get a package deal which included breakfast, one way airport transfer, Seine river tour and a one day unlimited metro pass which was great. The breakfast was quite good - besides the usual coffee and croissants there were a selection of meats and cheeses, fruit, fruit salad, yogurt and cereal. Eggs were available but you had to pay extra. All in all a great place to stay in St Germain and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing spot to perch, right up against the bustle & excitement of St. Germaine.”
Reviews.Author: CocoNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with lovely, multi-lingual staff. Bon bons on the pillow at night. Our 2 teenage boys felt comfortable navigating to and from the hotel. Great location for sight-seeing, shopping, eating & getting to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location & super staff”
Reviews.Author: TandyTake
Reviews.Content: I spent 8 nights at the Millesime while taking a cooking class with cookbook author Patricia Wells. The location was perfect for me--only steps away from the cooking studio, and very near to the St. Germain and Mabillon Metro stops. The multilingual staff could not have been kinder. All the restaurant reservations I requested in advance were in place when I arrived. The computer in the lobby is a wonderful amenity--I stayed in touch with home for free, and never used a phone. My superior class room and bathroom were large by Paris standards, with a very comfortable bed. The closet was small & coffee could have been better--but those are minor points. A great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in St Germain de Pres”
Reviews.Author: YannisM
Reviews.Content: It is a very cozy small hotel.... very nice and in a good location. Everithing is close. Luvre Notre Dam, Aifel Tower, Metro, excellent restaurants nearby. The only thing is that it was a little bit pricy, I guess because of the season! Will be back....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: Agydcd
Reviews.Content: Went to the hotel last night, booked very late and still managed to get a fantastic room with a balcony, all alone on the courtyard, it was fantastic. Staff was friendly and breakfast in bed was really good. Bathroom very large and comfortable bed. I recommend for a romantic stay in the loveliest neighbourhood of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, fab location”
Reviews.Author: LMouse
Reviews.Content: Thanks Tripadvisor contributors - this place was perfect! We were looking for somewhere close to where other family members had booked an appartment, and this sounded like the best bet in the area -we were not disappointed. Friendly and efficient welcome, lovely room (superior, on 3rd floor) good sized room, really clean. Lots of stairs, but there is a little lift so you can avoid them! Breakfast was lovely, very relaxing - good spread of breads, cheese, meats, cereals, fruit, juices, huge range of teas, pastries etc. Very pleasant. Lots to see nearby, shops, places to eat etc, lovely historic area. Would go back there without a moments hesitation :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location, nice”
Reviews.Author: starynight
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Millésime several times both with my husband, in a superior room, and as a solo traveler, in a classic room. The location is perfect - convenient to several métro stops, many restaurants, shopping, and within walking distance - 5 to 10 minutes - to many sights including the Louvre, Notre-Dame, Latin Quarter and Luxembourg Gardens. The rooms are pleasantly decorated, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms spotless and large (by European standards). The staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. The hotel offers special "promotions" which are very interesting. The winter promotion includes the room, buffet breakfast, one-way transportation to/from CDG airport/train station. If you are looking for a quiet, charming well-located, well-priced hotel in Paris, search no further.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, pleasant staff, plentiful breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: peaksgram
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from spending three nights at the Hotel Millesime 15 rue de Jacob in Paris, we were traveling with another couple, we all found this lovely hotel to be just perfect for our needs. The location was convenient to the metro, and within walking distance of all the main attractions and many wonderful restaurants. The rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet. The staff all were more than helpful with all our needs, whether it was food, directions, providing our transfers or just being available at all times. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katyjoyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: This is a really lovely 3 star hotel in a wonderful quiet position in Saint Germain, the lively area of Paris. The Hotel is in a side street, the beautiful Rue Jacob, which has lots of art galleries, the designer textile houses in Rue Furstenberg is just steps away and do check out the new designer store tucked at the end of that street, that had just opened when we were there, quite amazing. Hotel is so very close to Ru de Buci where we started each day with breakfast at Cafe Paris. Oh to just sit and watch the Parisians going to work, the flower market across from the cafe and the buzz of it all. There are numerous cafes, shops, restaurants in this area, and it is so close to the Seine that you can walk to everything. The Hotel staff are very helpful in everyway, the courtyard is very pretty, the rooms are very comfortable with all that you would need. All in all a quality 3 star Hotel for the middle of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: vluv2travel2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and service, staff was very helpful. Our family of four included a teenager and a 12yr old, we would recommend the Superior rooms. We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and walked / took the metro to most of the sights. Guided tours (Monet gardens / Versailles) do offer a pick-up service at this hotel. Continental breakfast and airport pickup was included. We plan to stay at this hotel again, wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Return to the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: CapeCarl
Reviews.Content: We got a warm welcome when our taxi dropped us off at the Millesime Hotel and plenty of support from the staff during our stay. The manager and the desk clerks were ready with good restaurant suggestions or just casual conversation whenever we passed through the lobby. Although the Milesime is a small hotel, there is room to sit and meet others in the lobby . There is also a public computer terminal. This was helpful because the Millesime like many of the hotels we stayed at in France subscribed to a sponsored wifi service with unreliable service. The rooms were nice but I would recommend getting a Superior to give yourself some elbow room. We ended up opting to have a reasonable continental breakfast brought to our room rather than having the buffet in the basement. Rue Jacob's location near St. Germain des Pres has moved upscale as the butchers have been replaced by trendy design boutiques. There is still a lot of vitality to the neighborhood with all the restaurants and bars on Rue de Buci and Rue de Seine. you can walk over to Notre Dame or across the Seine to the Louvre easily and the Metro is right at St. Germain des Pres. We tried staying near the Champs Elysee on our last visit and found it quite relaxing to be back on Rue Jacob.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & comfortable, good bathroom, yummy breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Red2830
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris & the Hotel Millesime was a perfect recommendation, given to us by two colleagues who stayed there 5 years ago. The staff are helpful and all speak English. They gave us two excellent restaurant recommendations; we wish we had asked them sooner, these places were so good. Our room (a Superior) was good-sized, clean and quiet, even though it was right on Rue Jacob (4th floor). It was wonderful to be in easy walking distance of the Metro and also be able to walk to the Seine and the Louvre, as well as Boulevard Saint-Germain. We hope to visit Paris again and we will defintely stay at the Hotel Millesime.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Quiet, Comfortable Room and Bath in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NanaSueNewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the end of June. It was not luxurious, but it was quiet and comfortable. We chose a Superior room in order to get enough space and a large bed. We were not disappointed. The room--#22-- exactly matched the photo in the promotion material. it had a desk, a little round table under the window, two side chairs and a small arm chair, good lighting, bedside tables and lamps, a mini bar and a flatscreen TV. It lacked charm but it was tasteful and spacious for a three star. The bed, two twins pushed together, was firm and comfortable. The linens were good quality and the bed was carefully made each day. Two good size windows overlooked the charming street and provided a fair amount of light. It was hot so we kept them closed and stayed cool with the central air conditioning. I did open them each morning to get fresh air and to watch the street cleaners and morning delivery men at work. and peek into the second floor library of the book store across the street. Even at this busy time, the noise was not objectionable with the window open and inaudible when they were closed. The closet was just arge enough and supplied with sufficient hangers for our clothes. Our suitcases fit easily into corners of the room. The bathroom was modern and immaculate. The floor was white tile, the somewhat narrow but deep bathtub had a shower head that could also be hand held. The pedestal sink was large with a rim that held a few items. A shelf above the sink would have been helpful but there was a small glass table next to the toilet and under a magnifying glass that held overflow items. The concierges were helpful and spoke excellent English. The computer in the lobby was available for all guests and never too busy. The concierge even printed out our return air tickets. They also called cabs for us. The breakfast room was attractive and free newspapers were available. There should have been a larger selection of food for 16E but it was adequate and the brewed decaf was refilled graciously. Alternatively, it would be easy to run out to a nearby bakery or deli and buy a croissant and juice and eat it in the patio off the lobby. The famed candy maker, Laduree, is across the street and serves breakfast but it would probably cost more than 16E. The hotel's location is tremendously convenient and delightful. Walking quite slowly we were at the St. Germain des Pres metro in five minutes, the Louvre in 15 and the D'Orsay in 20. Art galleries, bookstores and high-end boutiques with beautiful clothes and jewelry provided great street window shopping. A small Lebanese restaurant two blocks down the street was fine for a light, inexpensive meal. Better, was Jadis, a taxi cab ride away and L'Epi Dupin, a slow 25 minute walk. Both were "hot" neighborhood restaurants manned by up-and-coming chefs. Each had a 33E prix fixe that was excellent. One important tip: Find out which terminal your flight departs from. Taxi drivers do not have this information and there are no signs with it on the entry roadway. We had a terrible experience finding Continental because it moved to a new terminal recently. We ended up driving back and forth between terminals at great cost.

Reviews.Title: “4th Time at Millesime and it still doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: lachat
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Millesime (our 4th stay in 4 years) from April 2-12. We were in room 24 this time. I was able to book a room under the Winter Promotion, which included a complimentary breakfast buffet, one way transportation from the airport, and one free night because our stay was more than 6 nights. We reserved a Standard Classique room (this is the smallest) and our cost was 152.l euros/night (adjusted for the free night). What a bargain! The same promotion is still available (now called Summer Promotion). These promotions are cheaper than the Tete-a-Tete package, which we have booked in the past and enjoyed. This hotel is such a great place. The rooms are well appointed and clean, the bathroom is roomy, the staff is very friendly and helpful, there is a computer in the lobby with free access to the internet (convenient for sending a message or looking up an address or museum times), and there is a nice little courtyard where we occasionally have sat in the afternoon with a bottle of wine, relaxing after miles of walking. The breakfast buffet is substantial - cheeses, meats, breads, yogurt, fruit, cereal, juice, tea, coffee. You can have cooked eggs, but there is a charge. You would easily pay 10-15 euros per person for such a breakfast at a cafe. Also, the breakfast hours are long, so you can eat early or late. The location of the hotel cannot be beat. It is on the rue Jacob, between Blvd. Saint Germain and the river. We walk almost everywhere from there - except the farthest points - like Montmartre. There are lots of small cafes in the area if you want a late night drink and there are great small French restaurants in every direction within a few blocks radius. Lots of expensive boutiques too (fun for window shopping). We have talked about whether we would choose to stay anywhere else if money were no object and have decided that for us, the only change is that maybe we would book the suite! http://www.millesimehotel.com/home-en.php

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional for price”
Reviews.Author: Venus_SA10
Reviews.Content: Great location 5 mins walk from Notre Dame and Louvre - amongst the thriving latin quarter with so many different types of licensed cafes, restaurants and quaint shops to choose from. A fair walk to the eiffel tower and arc de triumph but metro around the corner if the feet give way. Our standard room was off the gorgeous court yard and reasonable in size - the room cleaned with nougat left on the pillows daily. Would say this hotel would be delightful in summer! The down side was the breakfast was over priced and average in selection - heading out to a near by patisserie was the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer1731
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Millesime for five nights in February and found the location to be convenient to many key sights and quiet because it's not on a main street. For a three star hotel, we found our Superior room to be larger than anticipated. The only minor inconvenience was the shower. If you're taller than 6', it's a little awkward. The winter promotion was a nice package because it included one-way airport transportation. We chose to use this service when we arrived at CDG and it was great. Our flight was delayed and the car service was waiting when we arrived. We had the concierge service arrange for the same car service (for a fee) upon our return trip. The breakfast included with the promotion was convenient and it allowed us to get a quick bite before heading out for the day. The room were the breakfast is served is quite nice and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Penetanguisheen
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 5 nights in March 2010 and were very happy with the hotel. The superior room was spacious, comfortable and clean. The bathroom looked recently renovated and was spotless. Everything worked well. The breakfast was good and though the breakfast room was charming, we had it delivered to our room. One of the main attractions of this hotel is its perfect location. It is within walking distance to the Louvre, Orsay museum, Notre Dame, and many good restaurants. We recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Stay”
Reviews.Author: amlootens
Reviews.Content: We read through lots of reviews on Trip Advisor before finally deciding on the Millesime, and definitely made the right decision. We were greeted warmly when we arrived and the staff made every effort to make us comfortable. The front desk staff was excellent and offered wonderful restaurant recommendations. Our room was very charming. The bathroom was spotless. Breakfast was included and very good - the coffee was excellent! Centrally located in the St. Germain area, the hotel was just a two blocks from Boulevard St Germain and several metro stations. We will definitely return - in fact, this is now our Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Saint Germain”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJoeyb
Reviews.Content: They do say location, location, location and this one has it. My husband and I stayed at Hotel Millesime for 3 nights in early October and were delighted with our choice. The hotel is small but very pretty. The rooms were definately comfortable and the bathrooms huge by European standards and quite luxurious. Our reservations were exactly as we requested even thought we did make changes from home by email a couple times. Our welcome bottle of champagne was a lovely surprise. The staff were wonderful, making restaurant reservations for us as well as printing our boarding passes and booking our taxi for the return flight home. We couldn't have asked for better treatment. Next time we plan a trip to Paris we won't even look at any other hotel - this is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, bit pricey though”
Reviews.Author: Allomenteer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first week of our honeymoon. The location is fantasic, easy walking distance to most of Paris, close to bus routes, metro etc. Of course a great location means a hefty price, quite expensive for a 3 star in paris, but agin for location you can't fault it. The concierge service was brilliant, staff really friendly and recommendations of local restaurants spot on. The room itself was quite large, and the bathroom well kitted out.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but wont stay there again”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonlnParis
Reviews.Content: We were recomended this hotel by our travel agent who had stayed there before. It was in a great location, minutes away from the metro and the Seine river. Overall it was a good hotel, they tried, but it wasn't great and wouldn't get my return business. The maids came in all the time, would knock and come on in.... to deliver something as little as 1 washcloth. The toilet wabbled and she tub shower was either hot or cold and would never stay where you put it. The curtin rod broke off so we were down 1 curtin. The maid took it assuming trying to fix it, then the front desk called us and asked us where the rod went. Uh, ask the maid, it was here when we left and isn't here now. It was never fixed before we left a few days later. The bed was 2 twin beds pushed together. The hotel is so old that it's impossible to get anything bigger up the stairs, which is totally fine. But when you book a room thinking it will be a king bed, only to find out someone is going to end up in the crack of the beds in the middle of the night, is misleading. They should book it as 2 twins, with the option of putting them together. Breakfast was actually pretty good even though the staff was very French and a little blunt. The front desk boys were pretty helpful, and the laptop in the front made it easy to check in with family. They really tried, but this hotel had a little too many quirks for my taste. There were plenty of other hotels on the same street that I think could have done the same job just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: btravaline
Reviews.Content: My friend and I selected the Millesime Hotel after much online research and we were very pleased with our choice. The hotel was charming, the room was very clean and attractively decorated. The bathroom was spacious with tub and shower. (Loved the make-up mirror in the bathroom!) The hotel staff was very helpful with requests for day trip information, train and metro connections. I was able to use the computer in the lobby each day for the internet/email. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeAnnually
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at this small hotel on a quiet street just a couple of blocks from the Seine. Wonderfully located for Notre Dame and the Louvre. the metro stop is only one and a half blocks away. We stayed in a Superior Room which was large by European standards. The room was comfortable, the breakfast was good, and the staff very helpful and spoke excellent English. You can find cheaper and you can find fancier but the location makes this one a real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien!”
Reviews.Author: BostonJonelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Paris to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. After reading reviews on TripAdvisor we chose Hotel Millesime. It was a charming hotel right near Saint Germain Blvd. We were walking distance to so many great cafes as well as the Seine River. The hotel was clean and modern, great bathroom. Breakfast was included each day and it was delicious. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, immaculate room/bathroom, service w/a smile!”
Reviews.Author: lmajia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 wonderful days/nights in Room 12 at the Hotel Millesime on rue Jacob. The room (#12) was large and the bathroom large as well. We were impressed by house plesant the staff was - from the front desk people to the housekeepers. Room service was prompt and generous. The room was plain but immaculate - and more importantly, so was the bathroom! The location could not be beat. I was afraid it would be too far from the rue de Buci action - it was not. But! That reminds me... even though we were close to the metro, the Buci action, restaurants, cafes, shops, etc., etc. there was no restaurant or bar adjacent to the hotel and as a result the hotel was quiet. Our room was right on the street and we never had any issue with street noise - no noisy delivery trucks or late night drinkers. We had been outpriced out of our previous favorite hotel Hotel Christine - the Hotel Millesime was totally credible and a great find! Would definately will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved everything about it, highly recommend it, will continue raving about it..”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: Enough said, no? Well, we loved the Millesime! Because of a terrible experience a few years back with Hotel L'Anglettere just a block away on Rue Jacob, I made it a point to confirm that the room I was reserving would look like the one on the hotel's website. The desk manager confirmed that it would and it certainly did not disappoint. We reserved a superior room on the second floor with large doors opening onto the Rue Jacob. There was a bottle of champagne, macaroons, and a lovely welcoming note upon our arrival, and what a thrill it was to swing the doors open and sip champagne while in the heart of Paris. The room was not large but certainly adequate, decorated in reds and yellows, with a large bed, desk, a small flat screen TV, and an armchair. The bathroom was newly remodeled with white and grey tile, shower over tub, and while there was not a cabinet in the bathroom, there was a thoughtful table in the corner to place one's toiletries. A cleaning lady left plenty of bathroom necessaries every day and sweets on pillows. The staff at the front desk is just terrific. We stayed five nights and interracted with three different clerks, all of whom spoke good English, were more than eager to provide directions, make suggestions and reservations, and all with most grace and a smile. There is also free internet access by the front desk. We did not have breakfast included in our nightly rate, but husband would go downstairs for cafe' creme every morning. Husband raved about the breakfast attendant who personally fixed his tray every morning and would summon the elevator for him. Great hotel providing superior service. What is not to love??

Reviews.Title: “Left Bank Winner”
Reviews.Author: BigDDetroit_MI
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel stay at the Millesime. Concierge was fantastic, especially Laurent. Have them arrange for a driver to get you from the airport to the hotel. It's worth the money. The location is near many cafes in an upscale neighborhood. A market is just around the corner where you can get a bottle of wine for 2,50 Euro. Also, a laundromat is across the street from a cafe. The hotel is very clean and quiet. The lift works well. The breakfast is great. The concierge is very helpful and speak English well. Only thing is, you have to ask for extras or specific things that you want. They are into serving the customer, but they don't really give advice unless you ask for it. Would highly recommend this for a romantic stay. The rooms are nicely sized, but nothing lavish. Just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: West-Jersey-Momma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 6 night stay at Hotel Millesime. We had booked an online special, pay for 5 nights, the 6th night was free. We stayed in room 34 which overlooked the patio. The room was quiet with a comfortable bed and a spacious bathroom (hairdryer and nice toiletries supplied). Everything was immaculate. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, choosing to frequent the nearby boulangerie (head W on rue Jacob, pass rue Bonaparte and it's on the other side of the street, very friendly and patient). We would get an espresso and a pastry for our breakfast, and also get one of their wonderful sandwiches for our lunch. There was a refrigerator in the room (stocked with soda, champagne etc. It had a section on top with wine glasses and a corkscrew). We bought wine, cheese, and olives nearby and had several simple meals out on the patio. All the desk staff were very helpful and spoke English. Laurent even noticed our al fresco dining and brought out a tablecloth and utensils. The hotel is 2 blocks from the St. Germain des pres metro, slightly further Mabillon metro, and about a 10 min walk to the RER Saint Michel station for your trip to Versailles. We walked most everywhere, but still used 2 carnets of metro tickets for the 2 of us . We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Cbers
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for the second time. This time with my mom. The room for two was an above average size for Paris hotels. The bathroom is fairly large. The rooms are clean, but sparse and the staff is very helpful and welcoming to those from the States. Rue Jacob is gorgeous and quiet( our room faced the street) and is a perfect location north of Bld St Germain, closer to the Seine and it's attractions. It is a reasonably priced hotel for it's quality in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but”
Reviews.Author: ButIdontWantTo
Reviews.Content: A couple minor complaints; the air conditioning was a little weak (we stayed in mid-August) and the guy at the front desk gave me very bad information about the Paris museum pass. When I found out he was wrong and pointed it out to him, he sort of tried to argue with me; also, the room could have used a couple more pictures, it felt a little stark. Other than that, it was a bright cheery place. The lobby and downstairs breakfast room felt like the south of France. The rooms were very clean and spacious, you couldn’t ask for a better location and the breakfast selection was outstanding. Overall it was a positive experience and we’d probably stay again due to the cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: breese4494
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter have just returned from a visit to Paris and London, and we stayed at the Millesime Hotel 3 nights. It's a small hotel but it is clean, and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We wanted two separate beds, and they accomodated us by separating the beds. We had clean towels, handtowels, and bathmats each day. There was a dryer in the bathroom. The continental breakfast was in a lovely room downstairs and the staff was very friendly. The hotel seemed to be centrally located once we kind of found our way around the area. I would recommend this hotel even though it is a small hotel. We did have one night when the fire alarm went off at 4:30 a.m., and this was scary since it was our first night in Paris, but they were apologetic that it was a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: grammatsi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millesime for six nights in late April---we were delighted with it! The location was perfect--easy walk to Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame etc. The immediate neighbourhood (6th A, St. Germain des PRes) was full of charming streets, interesting shops, great restaurants! Hardly needed the subway! And that was great because surely, along with museums, walking in Paris ranks right up there and we were able to do a lot! We booked tete a tete and went one up from the basic bedroom--for Paris hotels, it was great. Room was small but as my Paris friend pointed out, there are two comfortable chairs, reading ligths and bedside tables on each side of the bed, plus a desk and chair--bathroom great. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfasts were great---fresh fruit every morning, yogurt, meats, cheeses, croissants, great bread---in a charming vaulted breakfast room run so cheerfully and efficiently by 'Madame' who remembered on our second morning how we liked the coffee. Eggs and bacon were availalbe at an extra charge but we did not partake. No question: we will be returning to the Millesime for our next trip to Paris! All the staff were very helpful---great recommendations for restaurants, etc. The tete a tete package provided our transport from the airport and a number of other things---we thought it was well worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem on the 6th”
Reviews.Author: batutay
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for 8 days, 4/11/09-4/18/09 and we a great time. The staff were incredibly helpful, very courteous and always ready to help, especially Laurent and Christian. This is THE gem in the city, close to the Seine, louvre, Notre Dame, Il St. L and a block from Blvd. ST Germaine where the metro is. We walk to busy rue de buci where all the action is, walk to the quai and be with other tourist and come home in a quiet, relaxing, cozy hotel. On our last day we met a couple who just arrived for a week stay and probably are on their 70's, said that they have been coming to this hotel for years. They walk to everywhere, including the Islands. The breakfast room was cozy and great to start our day. Love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice out of many in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Trig_and_Yuko
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff was helpful, rooms were decent, bed was comfortable. It was a good place to operate from to go to the Louvre and Musée d'Orsay. Also, Ladurée is very nearby, where you can get delicious macaroons!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gogsdad
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Three teenagers and I just returned from a stay in Paris at the Hotel Millesime. We secured two rooms after a reccomendation from a friend and could not have been more pleased. The Hotel and Staff were polite, friendly and helpful. The location perfect, in walking distance to Lourve, Notre Dame and many more wonderful spots. The St GermainTrain stop is just around the corner. The resturants in the area were also quite good. We tried several and were never dissappointed. My wife enjoyed the Shopping and found much to bring home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cozy Hotel Millesime”
Reviews.Author: mrseiselburger
Reviews.Content: A January trip to Paris with two friends--and we landed at the Hotel Millesime for four nights. The hotel is charming, and the location is wonderful. Our room was even tinier than I thought it would be--and for three, but the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was down right roomy for Paris, the breakfast delicious, and the breakfast room very sweet. Internet was available in the lobby, and we had several nice dinners nearby (recommended by the hotel), including Fish. Had wanted to stop at Laduree, which is a block away, but didn't make it. Great location from which to explore the Left Bank and all of Paris. I thought the hotel a little pricey, but with the dollar so pathetic, it's hard to tell.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel in an excellent situation in St Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: MorganP
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay of 4 nights in the hotel.We were in room 44 on the fourth floor overlooking an interior courtyard. It was an excellent room- quiet/spacious and with all the facilities you would want. Very important for February was the heating system in the room which was very effective and easy to control. The buffet breakfast was good -though the coffee and tea was invariably luke warm. Reception and other staff were very friendly.Overall and excellent 3 star with a great position in St Germain des Pres.We paid 169 euro which included a half bottle of champagne and 2 tickets for the bateau mouche.On St Valentines night a nice touch was the rose left on the bed when we returned after a day out. We packed a lot into 4 days includintg -a TGV trip to lille/ a night at the ballet at the Opera Garnier(it is easy to book on line but our seats in a loge were not great) a visit to the Orangerie(its small and doable in a few hours). We ate out at the Relais de l'entrecote (steak house on nearby rue st Benoit)-would recommend/L'Epui Dupin near the bon marche-reservations essential and Le temps Perdu on Rue de Seine-if you book this restaurant online you are offered a free aperatif.I was offered a whisky or champagne and my wife who does not drink alcohol got a half litre of Vittel.This restaurant offers good value ...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris and the Millesime”
Reviews.Author: njtraveler4444
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our first trip to Paris and can't wait to return. We spent a wonderful 5 days in the City of Lights. We did some research and decided to book our stay at the Millesime Hotel in the St. Germain section of Paris (6th arrond). We are so glad we did. Before we even arrived in Paris our contact with the Millesime was professional and very helpful. We emailed them quite a few time with questions and requests and each time we received a response immediately that answered all of our questions. This small hotel is very comfortable and well maintained. We stayed in a superior deluxe room, which I recommend because it is more spacious than normal European rooms and has a king size bed and plenty of space. The bathroom is also well equipped and meets American standards. The staff at the Millesime is excellent from housekeeping to the concierges Lohan and Francois, who were extremely helpful and offered great directions and suggestions. Lastly I can't say enough about the location. What a great area of the city to stay in...walking distance to the Lourve, Notre Dame and Musee D'Orsay. We even walked to the Eifel Tower. The neighborhood has the most wonderful cafes that are open morning to night. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel on the Left Bank”
Reviews.Author: txchic
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Millesime is in the perfect location for seeing all the sights of Paris. We walked to Le Louvre, La Musee de Moyen Age, Musee d'Orsay, Picasso Museum, and Sainte Chapelle. The Arc de Triomphe and Tour Eiffel were a good hike away, and we could have taken the Metro, but we managed to walk the distance. Right around the corner were some of the best restaurants, and fairly reasonably priced (despite the depressing dollar to euro exchange rate). Since there are several universities nearby the area was bustling with students and had a vibrant feel to it. The hotel itself is absolutely wonderful. Our room was right next to the reception area, so I think the booking agency must have booked the last room available. Our friends had rooms on the third floor. Nevertheless, both the room itself and the bathroom were spacious and clean. The air conditioning worked well and kept our room very cool, just the way my husband likes it. The lobby is small but functional with a computer offering free internet access. There is a small courtyard with table and chairs where, one evening, along with our friends we enjoyed wine and cheese that we bought earlier in the day. The reception staff accommodated us with glassware and silverware. The breakfast included in the price of the room was excellent. Every morning there was an assortment of breads, pastries, charcuterie, cheeses, fruits and juices. We also had our choice of coffee, decaf coffee, tea or chocolate. The front desk was mostly staffed by young people and I cannot complement them enough on how amiable they were. They fulfilled all our requests with smiles and always exhibited the most pleasant demeanor. One of our traveling companions took ill and the staff called a local doctor who came right away to attend to her. Since our 4-day stay at the Hotel Millesime was the first part the our trip to France we were off to a good start for the remainder of our 2-week trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Millesime Hotel was Great”
Reviews.Author: cherryNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millesime Hotel for 11 nights. We chose the hotel because of its location, its reviews in tripadvisor, the hotel per night cost and the hotel's amenities. Also, the emails I sent them prior to booking were always answered in detail and very promptly. We couldn't have been happier. The location was perfect for us. The hotel is on the left bank in St. Germain des Pres (6th arrondisement) and it is only a 10-15 minute walk from the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay and Notre Dame. This area is very convenient to both the Metro and many, many good restaurants. This is a 3 star hotel with air-conditioning and an elevator. With the dollar so weak at this time, we found the price of this hotel to be reasonable for what was included. The staff could not have been more helpful, gracious and informed. Being Americans with very little knowledge of the French language, we were so pleased that the staff spoke and understood English so well. The hotel is small which made our stay very cozy. We never waited more than a few minutes at the concierege desk, the phone was answered immediately, the elevator always came right away and their free internet access was always available with a very short wait. The amenities of the hotel are listed on their website. However, not listed are the lovely shampoos and shower gel they provided. We booked the tete-a-tete package (3 night minumum stay). We chose a superior room which was quite roomy. Our room faced rue Jacob, a quiet street in this area. Since the hotel is air-conditioned we kept the window closed at night to keep out any noises. The package included a wonderful, very plentiful buffet breakfast that is served until 11 AM. Included are cold cereals, yogurt, cheese, sliced meats, fresh whole fruit and fresh cut up fruit, fresh squeezed juices and the most delicious pastries (croissants, pain au chocolate and chaussons filled with apple). Also, included in the package is an hour boat ride on the seine, a full day pass on the Metro, a pick up from OR return to the airport (one way), a 1/2 bottle of champagne and fancy cakes on arrival, a 1/2 bottle of chablis the night before checkout and an invitation for a complimentary drink at Cafe Laurent which is a jazz bar in their sister hotel which is the 4 star Hotel d'Aubusson. We would very much like to recommend this hotel. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BostonK
Reviews.Content: The staff is very pleasant at this hotel and the rooms are clean. The rooms, unfortunately, are tiny. You must turn on the air conditioning to block noise from the guests entering the courtyard at all hours. Even though this hotel describes itself as completely non-smoking, smoking is allowed in the the interior courtyard. If your windows are open, you will smell the smoke. The minibar stopped keeping things cold after a couple of days, but despite our request, nothing was done to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Perversia
Reviews.Content: When we looked for a hotel for our honeymoon, we wanted somewhere that would have reasonable room sizes, convienient location and something a little extra. Considering the number of hotels in Paris, this was not that easy but the Tete a Tete package was perfect. We were met at the train station by our pleasant driver and driven in a very clean, comfortable car to the hotel. It took a while as it was rush hour but it was great seeing the city at night. Check in was simple and we were given lots of information about the package. The room itself was clean, a good size and our bottle of champange waiting on ice. We had a street facing room but with the window closed, you could hardly tell as the noise was minimal. Also, there was very little noise from other rooms. The bathroom was nice, although the shower a little hard to control the temperature. Breakfast was reasonable. The first day, we had it sent to our room and it came early. My only complaint was that they still knocked on the door later to collect the tray, even though we had put the do not disturb sign outside. Down in the buffet room, service was a little brisk but it was mainly self-serve so this was not a problem. The reception staff were incredibly helpful, especially when we had to report a theft. They translated everything into French and wrote it down so that things would go smoothly at the police station. My only problem was our luggage was left out in reception and not in a secure room when we were out during the final day but this was not a huge problem as reception is manned at all times. Location wise, the hotel is perfect. The area (St Germain des Pris) is quiet and felt very safe. It's also quite close to main attractions, the Metro and some very nice restaurants/cafes. We both definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot and did the job...”
Reviews.Author: mark71Sydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in mid Oct whilst RWC07 was on and Paris was in full swing. Delightful little hotel. Loved the lift and staircase. Breakfast was good, a delightful taste of France, and room nicely furnished and plenty of room and clean. Would recommend to others and stay again. Steps from the door and you are amongst St Germain and across the river to the Louvre, so top location too.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: AmFromDC
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, I was shown a room that was completely unacceptable - - on the ground floor next to the reception desk, very tiny (not the main problem), with a large window right on the street so that you could see and hear everyone walking by only a few inches away. But the worst part was the overwhelming smell of some kind of disinfectant that made the room uninhabitable. The receptionist opened the window (making it louder and unsafe) and said the smell would go away soon. I couldn't stay in the room and waited outside. After a half an hour the smell was just as strong. The hotel refused to give me a different room, even though there was one available (a higher priced category), despite even asking for the manager. So I left and stayed elsewhere. The rudeness of the staff was matched by the miserable room they tried to give me. This was my 15th trip to Paris, so I am used to small rooms and a bit of an attitude but this was way into the unacceptable range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: tennismom710
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Paris, where we stayed at the Hotel Millesime. We were very pleased with this hotel and would recommend it to others without hesitation. First, it is in a great location for visiting the central sights of Paris, with great access to shopping, restraurants, Metro, etc. More to the point, however, the "tete a tete" package they offer for 225 euros is an unusually good value for the area. It includes transfers to and from the airport, breakfast, a one-day Metro pass, two drinks at the bar of their sister hotel, a welcoming bottle of Champagne and a departing bottle of wine, along with macarons from Laduree, and a boat tour of the Seine. The room is generous for Paris standards, with plenty of closet space, and the bathroom is more than adequate. In addition, we found the staff to be helpful and friendly; we have a hard time believing the complaints from the Australia guest concerning unauthorized credit card use. The desk employees were helpful in every way, printing out maps, making and confirming dinner reservations, following up on housekeeping requests, etc. We wrote a letter to the manager specially remarking on the good service we experienced. The breakfast was also very nice, and the woman in charge did whatever she could to accommodate special requests. The rooms were spotlessly clean and were made up timely each day. The only thing negative (and it did not bother us particularly) is that the street noise on the Rue Jacob starts early in the morning with the garbage pickup. If one is a light sleeper, it is probably a good idea to request a room facing the courtyard instead. Also, this is a three-star hotel, so one should not expect bell persons, etc. Usually, the desk person is the only one on duty (also not a problem for us). We think this hotel deserves a far better rating than it now has, and we will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Give Them Your Credit Card Details”
Reviews.Author: Critic1
Reviews.Content: Do not give your credit card details to this hotel. They charged my card without my permission. The conduct of the hotel management and staff were reprehensible. Don't trust them. Here are some other hotels in the lovely St Germain area, chosen at random from the Michelin red guide: Bersoly's, Beaubourg, Bretonnerie, Le Rives de Notre Dame, Bourg Tibourg, Royal St Michel, Relais Medicis, Madison, Villa Pantheon, Left Bank St Germain, Au Manoir St Germain des Pres, Grand Hommes

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for second time”
Reviews.Author: cbir
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millesime Hotel in May 2007 for our second time. We decided to give it a second go because it is a lovely hotel, and the package we booked was an excellent value. We couldn't find another hotel in the St Germaine area that could beat their value, and we knew the superior rooms were actually lovely and very spacious. We were given the room right next to where we stayed the first time 2 years ago, and we were just as happy with the room - quiet, clean, large, room for our stuff and a more than adequate bathroom. It's a really terrific location. We always felt safe on the streets around it at night and it was pretty quiet. This stay at the Millesime was significantly better than our first. We were picked up at the airport, we had a bottle of champagne and macaroons waiting for us and the staff was quite nice. The continental breakfast was fine - the location downstairs is lovely - and the private courtyard is a nice place to read the paper in the morning or relax in the afternoon. We love the neighborhood. It is walking distance to everything and the bus and Metro (2 different lines!!) are a block or two away. Our package included a Seine River cruise that we did at sunset - that was really a great time to go. We also had drink vouchers at the Jazz bar at the sister hotel - the Hotel D'Aubbusson (beautiful hotel if you can afford it!). That was fun, but we didn't read the coupon, and I ordered a Kir Royale - my first yummy one ever - but it was really pricey (It was 30 Euros) and not included. Oh well.
