We sat in the courtyard and had a nice time. They also included 2 all-day Metro passes, but we walked everywhere on this trip and never used them. Would have been good if it had rained, though. The Rue de Buci and the famous ones - Cafe Flore, Les Deux Magots and Brasserie Lipp - are nearby and the ice cream on Rue de Buci was better there than on Ile St Louis at Berthillon. REALLY!! I wish I could remember the name. But who cares - the house wine at cafes is usually excellent, and a lot less expensive than Coke. So grab a chair at a cafe, order a half carafe of red or white and have some French bread and cheese and people watch. Life doesn't get better than that. You walk so much in this city that you can eat just about anything you want. We did get to see the Monet murals in L'Orangerie this time. Don't miss it - definitely worth the wait!!! And the renovation at Le Petit Palais is beautiful. And don't miss a picnic lunch in the Rodin Musee garden. And if you want to see the city from up high - go to the Tour Montparnasse. You get a view with the Eiffel Tower instead of with the hideous Tour Montparnasse. Plus, that was a great walk - we hadn't been to the neighboorhod before. Now let's do something about the weak dollar so I can go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: TomandLor
Reviews.Content: We are pleased to report a most enjoyable stay at the Millesime. The staff were courteous and the location was quiet yet close to the Seine, Blvd. St. Germain and public transit. Lovely decor, reasonable rates, powerful A/C in the good-sized room, and prompt room service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, charming hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Parisio
Reviews.Content: The Millesime is a very charming hotel on a perfect street within the ideal location in Paris. We stayed at the attractive and delightful Millesime Hotel in May 2007 and very much enjoyed our experience. Rue Jacob is the perfect, quiet street located in the heart of the action with easy access to virtually anything. Situated across from Laduree is a sweet bonus! I’m familiar with Paris and am partial to staying in this this area, in the 6eme, and so I've stayed in many of the small boutique hotels nearby. I enjoyed this hotel the most due to its warm style, décor, and charm. Our Standard Chambre was cozy for two, but would be perfect for a solo traveler. The bathroom was tremendous in size, modern, sparkling, and had a shower attached to the wall which I know is important to many. The Superieure Chambres were already booked, however, we did see one while there. The Superieure was significantly larger, much more spacious, very comfortable, and I’d wholeheartedly recommend it. I wasn’t able to see a Suite. I’m not a breakfast-in-the-hotel person as I’d rather be out in a cafe, but did take advantage of it one day and it was lovely. The dining area is in a rustic cave and served is a nice selection of breakfast options. The front desk staff was very warm, courteous, helpful, and accommodating … even indulging my atypical requests for discussing and listing the latest and greatest French music CDs. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Paris Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lexma90
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and nicely decorated, and clean. Our room, a triple, was a good size, and our son's bed was a bed, not a cot, which was nice. The staff was very helpful with all of the questions we had. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, preferring instead to eat a continental breakfast at nearby cafes, so I can't comment on the breakfast. We are familiar with the neighborhood, and enjoyed the proximity to the cafes on rue de Seine and rue de Buci, and to Laduree and Jean-Pierre Carton for pastries. It was also close to the metro, and only one block away from St-Germain-de-Pres, both the boulevard and the church. The only less-than-perfect item was that there was no light above the bathroom sink mirror; in the daytime, there was enough light, but at nighttime it was a little dim. I hope to return to Paris, and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Quaint quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: duckhead520
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millesime for one week in May. We booked the hotel's package which includes a one way transfer to or from the airport, a seine river cruise, breakfast at the hotel every day and other small services. We found the location of the hotel to be excellent. We were in the heart of St. Germain, steps from the pedestrian walkway St. Andres Des Arts, leading directly to the Latin Quarter. There were loads of cafes and restaurants steps away from the hotel. The hotel itself is located on a very quiet street. We had a first floor room and were not bothered by street noise (and we are light sleepers). The breakfast each day is croissants, rolls, bread, fruit salad and some sliced ham. It was quite adequate for us. The staff at the hotel were all extremely pleasant and went out of their way to be accomodating. The room was not huge but it was not a closet either. There was no dresser to put clothes away in, but there were cubby spaces in the closet where one could place socks, etc. We were given champagne and macaroons on our arrival and the night before we left, we found a demi bottle of chablis on ice awaiting us. We were very happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_From_MSP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six days at the Millesime with my 15 years old son. We stayed on a decent size room for three people. This is a quaint and pleasant hotel on a great Paris location. Couldn't say better things about it. A very pleasant experience overall. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help. The breakfast was plentiful and was also very fresh. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet yet centrally located place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Seemless Experience at the Millesime”
Reviews.Author: Paramourfa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really an excellent find for the location. Situated on the lovely Rue Jacob, it is quiet with a very accomodating staff. (The woman with the dark glasses who works the breakfast room does her best to make sure that all goes well.) The staff at the front desk was always pleasant and helpful when needed. Frankly, in an area of hotels with smallish rooms, this one has rooms that are quite adequate. My wife and I have stayed here for the last two visits and would return next year. Lets all wish for a stronger dollar.

HotelInfo.Name: Millesime Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 15, rue Jacob, 75006 Paris, France
